events.originalText: A suicide bomber killed 21 people, including a two-month-old baby, and injured 60 others inside a restaurant in Haifa, Israel.
events.subtitle: Maxim restaurant suicide bombing
events.headline: Suicide bomber kills 21 in Haifa restaurant attack

events.originalText: The Soviet spacecraft Sputnik 1, the first artificial satellite to orbit the Earth, was launched from the Baikonur Cosmodrome.
events.subtitle: Soviet space program
events.headline: Soviet spacecraft Sputnik 1 launched into orbit

events.originalText: World War II: Allied forces execute Operation Leader, an air raid against German shipping near Bodø, Norway.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied forces execute Operation Leader in Norway

events.originalText: Willie Gillis, one of Norman Rockwell's trademark characters, debuted on the cover of The Saturday Evening Post.
events.subtitle: Willie Gillis
events.headline: Norman Rockwell's Willie Gillis debuts on magazine cover

events.originalText: Great Syrian Revolt: Rebels led by Fawzi al-Qawuqji captured the city of Hama from the French Mandate of Syria.
events.subtitle: Great Syrian Revolt
events.headline: Rebels capture Hama in Great Syrian Revolt

events.originalText: An ammunition plant in Sayreville, New Jersey, U.S., exploded, killing around 100 people and destroying more than 300 buildings.
events.subtitle: Sayreville, New Jersey
events.headline: Ammunition plant explosion in Sayreville kills 100

events.originalText: First World War: The Allies devastated the German defence at the Battle of Broodseinde, prompting a crisis among German commanders and causing a severe loss of morale in the 4th Army.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Allies devastate German defence at Battle of Broodseinde

events.originalText: Texas A&M University opened as the first public institution of higher education in the U.S. state.
events.subtitle: Texas A&M University
events.headline: Texas A&M University opens as first public institution

events.originalText: American Civil War: Union forces capture Galveston, Texas.
events.subtitle: Union Army
events.headline: Union forces capture Galveston in American Civil War

events.originalText: Forces from the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth break the Russian siege of Smolensk.
events.subtitle: Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth
events.headline: Polish-Lithuanian forces break Russian siege of Smolensk

events.originalText: Skanderbeg and Gjergj Arianiti sign a peace treaty to end the Albanian–Venetian War.
events.subtitle: Skanderbeg
events.headline: Peace treaty signed to end Albanian-Venetian War

events.originalText: Red Turban Rebellions: The rebel leader Zhu Yuanzhang won the Battle of Lake Poyang by deploying ships intentionally set aflame when the emperor tried to escape.
events.subtitle: Red Turban Rebellions
events.headline: Rebel leader Zhu Yuanzhang wins Battle of Lake Poyang

events.originalText: Otto IV, Holy Roman Emperor (seal pictured), was crowned.
events.subtitle: Otto IV, Holy Roman Emperor
events.headline: Otto IV crowned Holy Roman Emperor
